The purpose of the course is to give students a good understanding of the operation of these investments; the benefits and pitfalls associated with them; and strategies to integrate them into the context of portfolio management
Course_Hard_Skills: Overview of alternative investments, Hedge funds, Managed futures, Private equity, Venture capital, Real estate, Commodities, Foreign exchange, Understanding investment operation, Benefits, Pitfalls, Portfolio management strategies.

Course_Description: covers the practical applications and issues of financial analysis, valuation, and investment of equities. Topics include, but not limited to, the basic analysis of financial statements; valuation models-e.g. DCF, free cash flows and other methods commonly used in the market; risk and return analysis; equity research and stock selection process; portfolio construction; active vs passive and other styles of investment; performance evaluation and appraisal
Course_Hard_Skills: Financial analysis, valuation, Investment of equities, Basic analysis of financial statements, Valuation models, Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis, Cash flow modeling, Risk and return analysis, Equity research, Stock selection process, Portfolio construction, Active vs passive investment, Performance evaluation, Appraisal.

Course_Description: strategies, business management, and institutions: an in-depth study of the hedge fund industry. We will study hedge fund trading strategies, the business model of hedge funds, hedge fund investors, as well as the institutional and regulatory framework in which hedge funds operate.
Course_Hard_Skills: Trading strategies, Business management, Hedge fund industry, Business model of hedge funds, Hedge fund investors, Institutional framework, Regulatory framework.

Course_Description: an introduction to the fundamentals of private banking and wealth management for High Net Worth (HNW) individuals. Topics covered include, but are not limited to, an overview of the Asian private banking and wealth management industry with particular emphasis on the Greater China market; portfolio management, optimization and asset allocation; investment advisory and credit risk functions; tax and wealth planning tools for mobility, retirement and estate, including trusts, foundations, and insurance; behavioral finance; client relationship management; family office; business ethics and professional standards; and laws, regulations and compliance issues.
Course_Hard_Skills: Private banking, Wealth management, High Net Worth individuals (HNW), Overview of Asian private banking and wealth management industry, Greater China market analysis, Portfolio management, Asset allocation, Investment advisory, Credit risk functions, Tax planning, Wealth planning, Trusts, Foundations, Insurance, Behavioral finance, Client relationship management, Family office, Business ethics, Professional standards, Laws, Regulations, Compliance issues.

Course_Name: Current issues in asset management and private banking industr
Course_Description: seeks to cover current development and current issues in the asset management and private banking industry. The issues identified may be related to new business opportunities, new risk areas, new development affecting the AMPB market/industry
Course_Hard_Skills: Asset management, Private banking, Identifying current developments, Identifying current issues, Business opportunities, Risk areas, Market/Industry analysis.

Course_Name: Investment consulting, institutional business and family office
Course_Description: aims to introduce the investment consulting industry and provides students with practical understanding of the industry in its relevance to the asset management and private wealth industry, particular in relation to institutional investors and family office
Course_Hard_Skills: Investment consulting industry, Asset management, Private wealth industry, Institutional investors, Family office, Practical understanding, Industry relevance.

Course_Description: covers the fundamentals of Venture Capital (VC) and Private Equity (PE) as well as the key elements within the ecosystem. VC and PE is one of the asset classes of alternative investments and is essential for financial investors to evaluate and understand the risk and return of this asset class. The course would be beneficial to students who are interested in the financial sector and in particular in investment in an alternative asset class including VC and PE in Hong Kong and the region. Hong Kong is the second largest Private Equity hub in Asia (outside of China which is a closed market, HK is the number one PE hub in the region indeed).
Course_Hard_Skills: Venture capital (VC), Private equity (PE), Alternative investments, Risk analysis, Return analysis, Financial sector, Investment in alternative asset classes, Investment evaluation, Hong Kong PE hub.

Course_Description: covers the advanced techniques for corporate financial risk management. Topics include (i) the identification and measurement of financial risk, (ii) risk management for equity portfolios, (iii) risk management for fixed income securities portfolios, (iv) risk management for derivative securities portfolios, (v) risk management for financial institutions, (vi) Riskmetrics, (vii) credit risk management, and (viii) the recent development of risk management tools and techniques in financial markets
Course_Hard_Skills: Corporate risk management, Financial risk identification, Financial risk measurement, Equity portfolio risk management, Fixed income securities portfolio risk management, Derivative securities portfolio risk management, Financial institution risk management, Riskmetrics, Credit risk management, Development of risk management tools and techniques, Financial market analysis.

Course_Description: provides students with the necessary mathematical techniques used in continuous-time finance. It covers stochastic calculus, partial differential equation and applied probability. After taking this course, one should be able to fully understand no-arbitrage theory, the Black-Scholes equation, risk-neutral probability and martingales. The purpose of this course is to lay down a solid mathematical foundation for students to learn more advanced topics in financial engineering, such as exotic options, interest rate derivatives and credit risk models
Course_Hard_Skills: Mathematical techniques, Continuous-time finance, Stochastic calculus, Partial differential equations, Applied probability, No-arbitrage theory, Black-Scholes equation, Risk-neutral probability, Martingales, Financial engineering, Exotic options, Interest rate derivatives, Credit risk models.

Course_Description: l focus on developing skills in translating financial models into spreadsheets and programs using Microsoft Excel and Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), examining popular financial and investment models, integrating spreadsheet functionalities, programming, and interfaces in financial applications, and hands-on experience in designing, coding, and debugging computer programs
Course_Hard_Skills: translating financial models into spreadsheets and programs using Microsoft Excel and Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), examining popular financial and investment models, integrating spreadsheet functionalities, programming, and interfaces in financial applications, designing, coding, and debugging computer programs.

Course_Name: Regulatory, operational and valuation issues in finance institutions
Course_Description: e examines with students’ practical issues involving financial institutions, with a focus on banks. These include how banks shapes and, in the meantime, are bounded by regulations the regulatory environment. In turn, how the macro regulatory environment then transformed into operational practices in financial markets. The course will also go into how these issues are incorporated into models for analysis and valuation purposes
Course_Hard_Skills: analyzing and valuating financial institutions (with a focus on banks), understanding regulations and macro regulatory environment, transforming the macro regulatory environment into operational practices in financial markets, incorporating issues into models for analysis and valuation purposes.

Course_Description: The main purpose of this course is to help students relate economic or finance theories to the practical experience from their employment. They will be supervised and assessed jointly by a faculty member and a supervisor/mentor from the participating company.
Course_Soft_Skills: ability to relate economic or finance theories to practical experience from employment, ability to work with faculty members and supervisors/mentors from participating companies, ability to receive feedback and assessments.

Course_Description: Behavioral finance is the application of psychology to financial behavior. We will explore various behavioral frames, biases and heuristics and examine their implications on the aggregate market, individual investors, cross-sections of average returns and corporate decision making in a world of limited arbitrage
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding behavioral finance, exploring behavioral frames, biases, and heuristics, analyzing the implications of behavioral finance on the aggregate market, individual investors, cross-sections of average returns, and corporate decision making.

Course_Description: designed to provide a broad, comprehensive introduction to structured finance and securitization. The following topics will be covered: (a) building blocks of structured finance, (b) mechanics of securitization and various securitized products, especially CDOs (collateralized debt obligations), (c) leasing, (d) project financing, and (e) fundamentals of structured finance modeling using Microsoft Excel.
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding structured finance and securitization, knowledge of building blocks of structured finance and mechanics of securitization and various securitized products (especially CDOs), understanding of leasing and project financing, knowledge of structured finance modeling using Microsoft Excel.

Course_Description: ethics, professional standards, and code of conducts and best practices, know your clients, sales and suitability, investor protection, anti-money laundering, timely and accurate communications, independence and objectivity, fair dealing, compliance issues and compliance handling, relevant local rules and regulations, and international best practices for investment professionals. Selected cases will be used for discussion in class
Course_Soft_Skills: knowledge of ethics, professional standards, code of conducts, and best practices, ability to know clients, ability to follow sales and suitability guidelines, ability to protect investors, ability to communicate timely and accurately, ability to remain independent and objective, ability to ensure fair dealing, ability to handle compliance issues, knowledge of relevant local rules and regulations, familiarity with international best practices for investment professionals, ability to discuss cases in class.

Course_Description: covers current developments in finance. Possible topics include security trading and market making, venture analysis, financial contracting, investment strategies for local markets and other current issues in finance.
Course_Hard_Skills: Understanding current developments in finance, knowledge of security trading and market making, understanding venture analysis and financial contracting, knowledge of investment strategies for local markets, ability to analyze and discuss current issues in finance.

Course_Name: Managing money in asset management and private banking
Course_Description: a Capstone course and students are expected to apply the core investment, valuation and portfolio theories, analytical / advisory tools and asset management knowledge, including risk management and regulatory compliance, into analyzing asset and private wealth management business cases
Course_Soft_Skills: ability to apply investment, valuation, portfolio theories, analytical/advisory tools, asset management knowledge, risk management, and regulatory compliance to analyzing asset and private wealth management business cases.
Course_Hard_Skills: applying core investment, valuation, and portfolio theories, applying analytical/advisory tools and asset management knowledge, applying risk management and regulatory compliance to analyzing asset and private wealth management business cases.

Course_Description: focuses mainly on market risk, the risk of unexpected changes in prices and rates. The first part of the course introduces basic concepts in risk management and builds the toolkit for measuring risk quantitatively. The second part of the course is devoted to studying the widely accepted Value at Risk (VAR) systems, including calculations, back testing and flaws of VAR. The course also touches on other aspects of financial risk such as liquidity risk, credit risk and operational risk
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding market risk and its consequences, knowledge of risk management, ability to measure risk quantitatively, understanding Value at Risk (VAR) systems including calculations, backtesting, and flaws of VAR, knowledge of other financial risk aspects such as liquidity risk, credit risk, and operational risk

Course_Name: Text analytics and natural language processing in finance and fintech
Course_Description: covers the main elements of natural language processing (NLP), text analytics, and text mining, providing students with a foundation in collecting, managing, and analyzing textual data with financial and economic applications in mind, such as FinTech.
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding the main elements of natural language processing (NLP), text analytics, and text mining, ability to collect and manage textual data with financial and economic applications in mind, ability to analyze textual data using NLP and text mining techniques, knowledge of FinTech applications of NLP and text analytics.

Course_Description: Financial engineering is the process of constructing new instruments by using bonds and individual derivatives such as forwards, calls, puts, and exotic options as basic building blocks. The process involves designing, pricing and managing the instruments. In this course, we anatomize a few popular structural products. We then discuss how to price these products by studying the price of the embedded exotic options
Course_Hard_Skills: financial engineering, constructing new instruments, bonds, derivatives (forwards, calls, puts, exotic options), designing, pricing, managing, anatomizing structural products, studying prices of embedded exotic options.

Course_Name: Big data analytics applied toward quantitative finance
Course_Description: provides students a foundation in managing and analyzing large datasets for applications in finance. The first part of the course focuses on building skills – data custodianship and performance computing. Through practice on real-world financial datasets, students will learn methods used to warehouse and retrieve data for high-performance statistical computing
Course_Hard_Skills: managing, analyzing large datasets, data custodianship, performance computing, real-world financial datasets, warehouse data, retrieve data, high-performance statistical computing.

Course_Description: The introductory course will go through the fundamental aspects of launching a technology entrepreneurial venture to complement the research and development activities in science and technology. It will expose students to common practices in venture development process such as opportunity identification andverification, to technology transfer and commercialization. Topics on legal subjects, e.g. intellectual properties & patent laws, and simple financing & strategic approach in the business plan will be covered
Course_Hard_Skills: launching a technology venture, research and development, venture development process, opportunity identification, opportunity verification, technology transfer, commercialization, legal subjects (intellectual properties & patent laws), simple financing, strategic approach in business plan.

Course_Description: Business programming is an introductory course that teaches you how to write computer programs using Python to collect, analyze, and interpret data from real-world applications. This course is designed for absolute beginners and will build the skills from scratch. Therefore, no prior knowledge or programming experience is required
Course_Hard_Skills: writing computer programs, using Python, collecting, analyzing, interpreting data, real-world applications.

Course_Description: aims to let students learn from industrial practical experience that complements the lecture learning and class activities. It aims at building up students’ own mindset and value through real life experience and mentored by the participating companies. It aims at developing students’ understanding of the challenge and solution in the entrepreneurial process, the practices of innovation, the strategic inter-relationship among Hong Kong and other cities in Greater Bay Area, and the global vision in the current economic atmosphere.
Course_Soft_Skills: building up students' own mindset and value, real-life experience, mentoring.
Course_Hard_Skills: learning from industrial practical experience, building students' mindset, real-life experience, mentoring, entrepreneurial process, innovation practices, strategic inter-relationship, global vision.

Course_Description: covers both technical and managerial aspects to provide a basic understanding of business analytics and show how it can be used by businesses to analyze their competitive posture more effectively, know their customers better and make better managerial and strategic decisions.
Course_Hard_Skills: technical aspects, managerial aspects, basic understanding of business analytics, analyzing competitive posture, knowing customers, making better managerial and strategic decisions.

Course_Description: introduces the principles of design, development and administration of database management systems in business, considering the user, developer, and administrator points of view. Students will learn the basic concepts involved in the design and management of databases in business applications, including database architecture, entity-relationship modeling, database normalization, structured query language, and database administration. Students will also acquire hands-on experience in designing and developing simple databases
Course_Hard_Skills: design, development, administration of database management systems, business applications, database architecture, entity-relationship modeling, database normalization, structured query language, database administration, designing and developing databases.

Course_Description: aims to develop an understanding of the concepts of systems analysis and design. Various system development methodologies will be elaborated and discussed. CASE tools will be used to illustrate how to construct a variety of system design documents
Course_Hard_Skills: systems analysis, systems design, system development methodologies, constructing system design documents.

Course_Description: focuses on the planning, scheduling, control, and evaluation of project management. The basic tools and techniques of project management will be explored, with special emphasis on engineering, management, and control of IS/IT related business projects. The evaluation of projects and project management will also be addressed, as will scope, time, cost, quality, human resources, communications, risk, and procurement.
Course_Hard_Skills: project management, planning, scheduling, project control, project evaluation, basic tools and techniques, engineering of business projects, management of business projects, control of business projects, evaluation of business projects, scope, time, cost, quality, human resources, communications, risk, procurement.

Course_Description: introduces telecommunications and computing networks used in the support of business activities. Topics include data, voice, image and communication technologies; networking and communication architectures; and protocols and standards
Course_Hard_Skills: telecommunications, computing networks, support of business activities, data technologies, voice technologies, image technologies, communication technologies, networking architectures, communication architectures, protocols, standards.

Course_Description: aims to put students in a lateral mind-set where they can challenge the conventional wisdom to think creatively, see the unseen to uncover opportunities, and explore the trade-offs involved in managerial decisions to design elegant and articulated solutions.
Course_Soft_Skills: creativity, critical thinking, problem-solving, decision-making.

Course_Description: builds on chaos theory to provide a roadmap for managers planning to transform their companies into an inter-networked enterprise where shared infrastructures are used to link customers, suppliers, partners and employees to create superior economic value. It covers business strategy, infrastructure, process management, and integration and implementation
Course_Hard_Skills: business strategy, infrastructure management, process management, integration, and implementation.

Course_Description: concepts and applications: Design methodology is closely related to the innovation process within different business contexts. This course aims to develop students’ design mentality and skillsets through idea conceptualisation, concept development, process, implementation, and project planning and management.
Course_Soft_Skills: creativity, problem-solving, project planning, and management.
Course_Hard_Skills: design methodology, idea conceptualization, concept development, process design, implementation planning, and project management.

Course_Description: get students to think and work through a comprehensive process in their hands-on projects. While striving to achieve business and social goals, students will be trained to utilize the hybrid viewpoints of analysts and creative designers to evaluate the nature of projects, their functions, and short-term and long-term impacts on different stakeholders
Course_Soft_Skills: critical thinking, problem-solving, creativity, teamwork, stakeholder engagement.

Course_Description: provides a platform for critical rethinking of the role of business in creating both business value and social values. It examines the business building blocks to explore win-win situations where economic success and societal benefits co-exist through innovative thinking and solutions, taking into account related trade-offs. Students will learn how to design businesses that can respond to increasing demands for a fairer and better society, a greener environment and greater work-life balance, whilst reducing costs, building customer loyalty, and attracting and retaining talents, thus creating long-lasting value
Course_Soft_Skills: critical thinking, innovative thinking, problem-solving, creativity, and designing solutions that take into account related trade-offs.
Course_Hard_Skills: business strategy, cost reduction, and customer loyalty building.

Course_Description: provides an overview of venture management in innovation development and commercialization for those who believe they have what it takes to build new businesses and ventures. The students will strengthen their know-how through listening and engaging in discussions, with guest speakers, through local and international business cases, and venturing
Course_Soft_Skills: listening, communication, and engagement in discussions.
Course_Hard_Skills: venture management, innovation development, commercialization planning, and know-how development.

Course_Description: Students will learn process analysis, management of process variability and its impact, process improvement with statistical tools, and applications in lean operations, using case discussion, in-class interactions, and hands-on projects.
Course_Hard_Skills: process analysis, process variability management, process improvement using statistical tools, and lean operations application.

Course_Description: covers the tools and the skills to analyze and solve problems by stressing approaches to 1) understand and question assumptions, 2) consider a richer set of solution alternatives, and 3) consider diverse measures of performance.
Course_Soft_Skills: critical thinking and problem-solving.
Course_Hard_Skills: problem analysis, solution generation, and performance measurement.

Course_Description: introduces sophisticated quantitative models and advanced tools such as discrete and continuous time Markov chains, renewal processes and other stochastic models to capture randomness in business processes. Students are expected to learn these mathematical models through lectures, skill-building exercises and qualitative class discussions
Course_Hard_Skills: advanced quantitative modeling, discrete and continuous time Markov chains, renewal processes, stochastic modeling, and mathematical modeling.

Course_Description: provides introduction to analytics used in quantitative finance and aims at equipping students with basic analytical knowledge and practical skills in solving investment and risk management problems. The course content is organized by main financial instruments: fixed-income securities, stocks, and financial derivatives; fundamental analytics for each instrument type will be taught. Implementation (e.g., fitting interest rate term structures, portfolio construction, pricing options by simulation, etc.) by developing analytics in spreadsheet/VBA or Python with financial data will also be emphasized
Course_Hard_Skills: analytics for quantitative finance, investment problem solving, risk management, understanding fixed-income securities, stocks and financial derivatives, portfolio construction, developing analytics in spreadsheet/VBA or Python with financial data.

Course_Description: provides a broad introduction to big data, including fundamental concepts and basic techniques for data acquisition and aggregation, state-of-the-art algorithms for data analysis, and technologies on modern computing platforms and systems for handling big data
Course_Hard_Skills: data acquisition and aggregation, data analysis algorithms, and technologies on modern computing platforms and systems for handling big data.

Course_Description: shows you how to better understand your data, present clear evidence of your findings to your intended audience, and tell engaging data stories that clearly depict the points you want to make all through data graphics. The skills learned in this course offer enormous value for creatives, educators, entrepreneurs, and business leaders in a variety of industries.
Course_Soft_Skills: presenting and communicating data effectively, storytelling through data graphics, and offering value to creatives, educators, entrepreneurs and business leaders.

Course_Description: Topics include decision support systems, group support systems, electronic meeting systems, artificial intelligence, expert systems, and neural networks. Both technical and managerial issues related to the development and implementation of decision support systems will be discussed.
Course_Hard_Skills: development and implementation of decision support systems, technical and managerial knowledge in Decision support systems, artificial intelligence, electronic meeting systems, expert systems, and neural networks.

Course_Description: The first part covers advanced database concepts such as views, triggers, stored procedures, SQL*Plus, database administration and performance tuning. The second part examines various techniques in data mining such as decision trees, neural networks, and clustering. Students will learn about the applications of these techniques in business.
Course_Hard_Skills: advanced database concepts such as views, triggers, stored procedures, SQL*Plus, database administration, and performance tuning, data mining techniques including decision trees, neural networks, and clustering, along with their applications in business.

Course_Description: learn how to develop Internet-based and mobile business applications using the resources, tools and services available on the Internet. Topics include HTML, Java applets, HTTP and CGI, JavaScript, Java Servlets and JSP, PHP, ASP, Web spiders and search engines, and mobile applications.
Course_Hard_Skills: developing internet-based and mobile business applications, knowledge of HTML, Java applets, HTTP, CGI, JavaScript, Java Servlets and JSP, PHP, ASP, Web spiders, search engines, and mobile applications.

Course_Description: provides an overview of recent developments of the telecommunications industry in Hong Kong and around the Asia-Pacific. Telecommunications infrastructure policies introduced by respective governments in the region and the impacts of these policies on business operations will also be examined
Topics to be covered include security policy, information security management, information technology governance, risk assessment and management, and security control.
Course_Hard_Skills: Security policy, information security management, information technology governance, risk assessment and management, and security control knowledge.

Course_Description: discusses contemporary issues in information systems, including emerging technologies and the ways they affect businesses

examines various issues related to the management of information systems in organisations. The link between information systems planning and business strategy will be explored to see how companies can use information systems not only to support their daily operations but also to sustain and enhance their strategic advantage
Course_Hard_Skills: management of information systems in organizations, exploration of the link between information systems planning and business strategy, using information systems for supporting daily operations and to sustain strategic advantage.

Course_Description: introduces various technologies and methods used in the design and development of multimedia applications in digital media industry. Students will learn how to develop interactive multimedia applications that use audio/video and 2D and 3D graphics. Related concepts including human-computer interaction, graphics design, and managing multimedia projects will also be covered.
Course_Soft_Skills: managing multimedia projects.
Course_Hard_Skills: design and development of multimedia applications, development of interactive multimedia applications using audio/video, 2D and 3D graphics, knowledge of human-computer interaction, and graphics design.

Course_Description: focuses on the systems approach to planning, analysis, design, development, and management of supply chain. Using cases and real-life projects, students will learn how to use appropriate information technologies to synchronize supply chain processes, thus reduce costs and improve service
Course_Hard_Skills: planning, analysis, design, development, management, information technologies.

Course_Description: introduces students to the core concepts of entrepreneurship with a special emphasis on entrepreneurial settings involving the use of information technology. Students will be exposed to the key processes, challenges, risks and rewards of starting up an entrepreneurial business. They will also learn to apply the concepts and knowledge learned in the course to develop a business plan that could be presented to potential investors and venture capitalists
Course_Hard_Skills: entrepreneurship, information technology, business development, and planning.

Course_Description: e provides an overview of enterprise resource planning systems and their use in the business environment. Topics include business processes management, functions and data requirements, and systems implementation and integration
Course_Hard_Skills: enterprise resource planning, business processes management, data requirements, systems implementation, and integration.

Course_Description: explores the emerging and revolutionizing role of the World Wide Web for marketing practice. A number of techniques for advertising over the Internet will be introduced. Students will explore the potential of advertising through Web technologies such as blog marketing, social media marketing and advertising, search engine marketing, search engine optimisation, email marketing, usability testing and website measurement
Course_Hard_Skills: marketing, advertising, Internet advertising techniques, blog marketing, social media marketing, search engine marketing, search engine optimization, email marketing, website usability testing, and website measurement.

Course_Description: focuses on business opportunities brought about by the Internet. Students will learn how to use web-based technologies to set up a business.
Course_Hard_Skills: internet commerce, web development, and business development.

Course_Description: designed to provide an overview of computer information systems auditing and control, and their application in the business environment. It is intended for general business students. Topics include the information systems audit process, information technology governance, systems and infrastructure lifecycle management, information systems auditing methodology and information security policy, information technology service delivery and support, computer-assisted audit tools and techniques, protection of information assets, as well as disaster recovery and business continuity planning
Course_Hard_Skills: computer information systems auditing, control, information technology governance, systems management, auditing methodology, information security policy, computer-assisted audit tools, protection of information assets, disaster recovery, and business continuity planning.

Course_Description: e focuses on the fundamentals of artificial intelligence (AI), with emphasis on business applications. Students will gain hands-on experience in developing and using different AI tools to solve real-world business problems. Topics include AI algorithms, intelligent agents, document management, expert systems, and data mining
Course_Hard_Skills: artificial intelligence (AI), AI algorithms, intelligent agents, document management, expert systems, and data mining.

Course_Description: provides a practical platform for students to apply their information systems knowledge in the real world. Under the supervision of a company executive and a professor, students will work in a company on a full-time basis for a minimum continuous period of six months
Course_Hard_Skills: information systems knowledge, practical application, and work experience.

Course_Description: examines the concepts, techniques, and activities related to information systems development projects. Teams of students will carry out projects that span the entire information systems analysis and design life cycle, including planning and scheduling, cost estimation, risk analysis, team organisation, process management and quality assurance
Course_Soft_Skills: team organization, process management, and quality assurance.
Course_Hard_Skills: information systems development, project management, planning, scheduling, cost estimation, risk analysis, team organization, process management, and quality assurance.

Course_Description: teach students how to create innovation-driven business model through both process innovation and product innovation. The focus is on businesses that are technology innovation driven. The course contents will cover disruptive technologies, cross-channel business model development, mobilization of networked business, canvas drawing, social media-based product and marketing innovation, etc. In particular, students will learn how to identify technology innovation opportunities and manage innovation process. The students can appreciate the value of IT ecosystems andplatformbased business operations.
Course_Hard_Skills: business modeling, process innovation, product innovation, disruptive technologies, networked business, social media-based innovation, managing innovation processes, and platform-based business operations.

Course_Description: provide students with the requisite knowledge, skills and tools to prepare, present and write up business case studies for both academic and business use. The skills gained will also prepare students for participation in (international) case competitions. Students will work in rotating groups and will have to prepare and present cases following the format used in various global case competitions. Students also will have to submit individual case reports
Course_Hard_Skills: preparing, presenting, and writing up business case studies, as well as following the format used in global case competitions.

Course_Description: provide students with a solid basis for developing such cultural competencies, so they can understand the challenges that might occur while working abroad and the principles of effective cross-cultural management. The course aims to develop an understanding of key cultural differences, and how these differences influence the management of individuals, teams, and organisations.
Course_Soft_Skills: developing cultural competencies, understanding challenges, and effective cross-cultural management.

Course_Description: A course on the concepts and key research findings which can help us to understand human behaviour in organisations. Topics include motivation, leadership theory, group dynamics, morale, communications, control techniques and organisational culture.
Course_Soft_Skills: communications, leadership theory, group dynamics, and morale.

Course_Description: equips students with the essential elements of entrepreneurship manifested in the issues, challenges and rewards of creating a new business. The process in creating a start-up company, indeed, the process of an entrepreneurial undertaking, will be examined, discussed and practiced in class in order to provide students with some first-hand knowledge and experience in the subject matter
Course_Soft_Skills: the ability to navigate issues, challenges, and rewards of creating a new business, as well as gaining first-hand knowledge and experience in entrepreneurship.
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding the essential elements of entrepreneurship and the process of creating a start-up company.

Course_Description: global business communication: aims at developing students’ business storytelling skills through the study of speeches, commercials, and other organisational narratives from around the world. By reflecting on the importance of storytelling in management, this course will help students become better leaders
Course_Soft_Skills: developing business storytelling skills and becoming better leaders through reflection.

Course_Description: European business culture through an interdisciplinary approach: (1) History and Geopolitics: to understand how the European Union came to be and its development; (2) Sociology: to examine different issues, such as cultural identities, politics, and ethics in the European context and their impact on business relationships; and (3) Management: to analyse practical issues in a European context
Course_Soft_Skills: the ability to understand cultural identities and politics, as well as analyzing practical issues in a European context.
Course_Hard_Skills: analyzing practical issues in a European context.

Course_Description: give an overview on the fundamentals of labour relations theories pertaining to trade unionism, collective bargaining and workplace labour-management relations. Particular attention is also given to the development of the labour market, employment pattern and labour law in Hong Kong.
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding the fundamentals of labour relations theories, trade unionism, collective bargaining, and workplace labour-management relations, as well as the development of the labour market, employment pattern and labour law in Hong Kong.

Course_Description: look at the basic concepts of human resources management (HRM) and its application to Hong Kong. Emphasis will be placed on the strategic linkage between HRM and corporate management in the context of business change and re-structuring. Comparative references will also be made to practices in other industrial societies.
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding the basic concepts of HRM and its application to Hong Kong, as well as the strategic linkage between HRM and corporate management in the context of business change and re-structuring, and making comparative references to practices in other industrial societies.

Course_Description: explore the problems and issues involved in the management of organisational change and development. Major approaches and attempts to conceptualise the phenomenon will be examined in a critical manner. Particular attention will be paid to problems arising from company formation, entrepreneurial ventures, company expansion and growth, maturity and bureaucratisation, corporate failure and recovery
Course_Hard_Skills: examining major approaches to conceptualizing organizational change and development, as well as paying particular attention to problems arising from company formation, entrepreneurial ventures, and corporate failure and recovery.

Course_Description: theory and practice: The management of human capital, or human resources, has the potential to be the source of competitive advantage in high-performance organizations. This course serves as an overview of the fundamentals of human resource management
Course_Hard_Skills: Hard skills mentioned includes understanding the fundamentals of human resource management as a potential source of competitive advantage in high-performance organizations.

Course_Description: A course to introduce a systems-oriented view of production and operations management
Course_Hard_Skills: Systems-oriented view, Production management, Operations management.

Course_Description: Topics includemanagement structures of control and co-ordination, high-commitment work systems, design of compensation systems, virtual organisation and the use of IT, organisational learning, organisational change, organisation for cultural synergy, and organisation of international companies
Course_Hard_Skills: Management structures, Co-ordination, Work systems, Compensation systems design, Virtual organization, IT use, Organizational Learning, Organizational Change, Cultural Synergy, and International Organization.

Course_Description: examines the principles and practice of designing and operating systems of work that combine the optimum use of technology with high performance and motivation. Topics include socio-technical systemsanalysis, teamwork and networking.
Course_Soft_Skills: Teamwork, Networking.
Course_Hard_Skills: Designing and operating systems of work, Optimum use of technology, High performance, Socio-technical systems analysis.

Course_Name: Human resource planning and career management
Course_Description: aims to provide an understanding of how the demand and supply of human resources can be brought into balance, and people already in employment can be helped to develop in their work careers. Topics covered include appraisal, counselling, development and training, and career planning. Ways in which HRM managers can facilitate organisational learning are also examined
Course_Soft_Skills: Appraisal, Counselling, Development and training, Career planning.
Course_Hard_Skills: Understanding demand and supply of human resources, HRM, Appraisal, Counselling, Development and training, Career planning.

Course_Description: provide students with knowledge in leadership theories, models and frameworks, with opportunities to experiment with natural and new leadership behaviour in a simulated context. Having gone through these processes in a collective, multi-staged exercise, there will be opportunity for reflection, sharing of experience and integration of practice with theories, in the presence of facilitators
Course_Soft_Skills: Leadership, Reflection, Sharing of experience, Integration of practice.

Course_Description: addresses the design of reward and compensation systems and the contribution they can make to the attainment of an organisation’s strategic objectives. Among the specific techniques covered are job evaluation, design of incentives, performance-related pay, and non-monetary rewards.
Course_Hard_Skills: job evaluation, design of incentives, performance-related pay, and non-monetary rewards.

Course_Description: explore key aspects of group dynamics through a process of experiential learning. The aspects that we shall be considering include leadership and communication, planning and organising, decision-making and problem solving, and trust and team building in the context of business and management. The activities you will undertake consist of a series of problems to be resolved through the combined efforts of your group members
Course_Soft_Skills: leadership, communication, planning and organising, decision-making, problem-solving, trust, and team building.

Course_Name: Current topics in human resource management
Course_Description: focuses on current topics in managing a firm's human resource management functions. In depth classroom discussion, management cases and applied business projects will be emphasised

Business organisations face unprecedented challenges today and managing change has become a crucial factor in their survival and performance. This course introduces the specialised topic of organisational change management. It provides students with an understanding of how organisational change is initiated and sustained.
Course_Hard_Skills: organisational change management, understanding how organisational change is initiated and sustained.

Course_Description: focus on the basic concepts of selections and recruitment, training and development of different employees, and human resources utility analysis. In particular, students will be exposed to different recruiting processes and the whole spectrum of training and development techniques, and how they can add value to business success
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding of basic concepts of selections and recruitment, knowledge of processes involved in employee training and development, expertise in human resources utility analysis.

Course_Description: focus on the basic concepts of pay and compensation policies for different employees. In particular, students will be exposed to fundamental pay and benefits administration, along with the importance of rewards and their impact on employee attraction, motivation and retention
Course_Soft_Skills: importance of rewards and their impact on employee attraction, motivation and retention.
Course_Hard_Skills: pay and benefits administration.

Course_Description: emphasizes on theoretical understanding of consumer psychology and applications to the development of marketing strategy. Specific consumer trends and new tools for consumer insights will also be integrated in class discussion. Students will be provided opportunities to apply the learned concepts and tools to marketing situations through class discussions, case studies, and group project
Course_Soft_Skills: application of learned concepts and tools to marketing situations through class discussions, case studies, and group project.
Course_Hard_Skills: theoretical understanding of consumer psychology and its application to the development of marketing strategy; knowledge of specific consumer trends and new tools for consumer insights.

Course_Description: cover the broad principles of marketing research. Emphasis will be placed on the use of marketing research as an aid to decision making. In this spirit, students will be introduced to a variety of types of marketing research data. Students will be given the opportunity to engage in practical marketing research-based exercises.
Course_Soft_Skills: engagement in practical marketing research-based exercises.
Course_Hard_Skills: broad principles of marketing research; knowledge of various types of marketing research data; ability to use marketing research as an aid to decision making.

Course_Description: cover the theories, applications, and issues related to advertising management. Attention will be paid to the process of advertising management, creative and message strategies, traditional and digital creative tools, media planning and analysis, and evaluation of advertising effectiveness.
Course_Hard_Skills: knowledge of advertising management theories, applications, and issues; understanding of the process of advertising management; ability to develop creative and message strategies; knowledge of traditional and digital creative tools; ability to plan and analyze media; ability to evaluate advertising effectiveness.

Course_Description: Through theories, examples, cases, and class discussions, students will learn to think more logically, creatively, and critically about the strategies involved in identifying, developing, managing, and growing brand equity
Course_Soft_Skills: ability to think more logically, creatively, and critically about branding strategies through theories, examples, cases, and class discussions.

Course_Description: focuses on current topics in managing a firm’s marketing functions. Organised along a seminar mode, students will explore real life experiences and exposures to firms, together with in-depth intellectual challenges, through classroom discussion, the study of management cases and applied business projects.
Course_Soft_Skills: exploration of real-life experiences and exposures to firms, in-depth intellectual challenges, classroom discussion, the study of management cases, and applied business projects.

Course_Description: explore the problems and issues involved in the management of quality improvement and market competition. Emphasis will be on the strategic aspects of quality and marketing management, in particular customer value, quality improvement tools, quality concepts, and the relationship of quality with different aspects of marketing management
Course_Hard_Skills: management of quality improvement and market competition; strategic aspects of quality and marketing management; knowledge of customer value; understanding of quality improvement tools and concepts; understanding of the relationship between quality and different aspects of marketing management.

Course_Description: focus on selected topics that are of salience to managing firm marketing strategies and operations in Mainland China or Hong Kong. It may include but is not restricted to contemporary marketing issues related to branding, new product development, marketing hightechnology products and customer relationship management
Course_Hard_Skills: knowledge of managing firm marketing strategies and operations in Mainland China or Hong Kong; understanding of contemporary marketing issues related to branding, new product development, marketing high-technology products, and customer relationship management.

Course_Description: shows how the basic principles of marketing can be applied to marketing problems across national boundaries and within foreign countries. Attention is paid to the development of global marketing strategies and to the different approaches needed to market consumer items, industrial goods and services internationally
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding of how basic marketing principles can be applied to marketing problems across national boundaries and within foreign countries; ability to develop global marketing strategies; knowledge of different approaches needed to market consumer items, industrial goods, and services internationally.

Course_Description: Substantive topics include: search advertising, social network analysis, data analytics, and human mobility. Lectures, discussions, live data-analysis demonstrations, class data exercises, video pieces, and student-led project presentations are major class components.
Course_Hard_Skills: knowledge of search advertising, social network analysis, data analytics, and human mobility; ability to analyze data live and through class data exercises; ability to present student-led projects.

Course_Description: examines the characteristics of service organisations and how this affects their approach to marketing. Issues in the three dimensions of internal marketing, transactional marketing and external marketing are examined, and the role of research analysed. Attention is paid to service culture and service value and problems are illustrated by examples from Asian, American and European service firms.

aims to help students gain an overall understanding of how to develop and manage innovations and new products. The course introduces theories of diffusion of innovations, determinants of successful and unsuccessful new products, and consumer perceptions of innovations and new products at different levels of innovativeness. Building on these theoretical perspectives, the course further introduces a systematic new product development (NPD) process from idea generation to commercialization and analyzes how the NPD process should be adapted according to different levels of product innovativeness
Course_Hard_Skills: developing and managing innovations and new products, theories of diffusion of innovations, determinants of successful and unsuccessful new products, quantitative data analysis, systematic new product development (NPD) process, commercialization of products.

Course_Description: covers both the economic theories of pricing, and the analytical tools for formulating effective pricing strategy. This course also discusses commonly used pricing tactics, including some of the newest pricing practices. The course is highly applied, and prepares students for pursuing a career in marketing, consulting, and finance
Course_Soft_Skills: formulation of effective pricing strategy, marketing, consulting, and finance career preparation.
Course_Hard_Skills: economic theory of pricing, analytical tools for formulating pricing strategy, pricing tactics, pricing practices, marketing, consulting, finance.

Course_Description: about collecting and analyzing secondary data. The focus of this course is on understanding the popular data structure, analyzing data and making sense of the results. We will focus on understanding data relevant to marketers, the types of data available, different designs or methods of data collection and analysis
Course_Hard_Skills: collecting and analyzing secondary data, understanding popular data structure, analyzing data, interpreting results, understanding data relevant to marketers, types of data available, different designs or methods of data collection and analysis.

Course_Description: will help students understand social media marketing from three perspectives—principles, applications and strategies. Social media and network theory, popular social media strategies, and data analytic tools will be introduced. Upon completing this course, students will be equipped with the knowledge and master skills which are essential to analyze, build, and manage real-world social media marketing campaigns.
Course_Soft_Skills: analysis, building, and management of real-world social media marketing campaigns.
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding social media marketing principles, applications, and strategies, social media and network theory, popular social media strategies, data analytics tools, analyzing, building, and managing real-world social media marketing campaigns.

Course_Description: exposes students to essential tools including data visualization, exploratory data analysis, as well as regression methods that can be used to convert raw data into marketing insights. For example, these tools will be used to investigate the impact of marketing activity on aggregate data (e.g., sales) and on individual-level choice data (e.g., brand choices)
Course_Hard_Skills: data visualization, exploratory data analysis, regression methods, converting raw data into marketing insights, investigating the impact of marketing activity on aggregate data and individual-level choice data.

Course_Description: aimed to provide advanced undergraduate students with knowledge and experience for the design of effective marketing strategies from a general management perspective. It examines the marketing management concepts underlying both consumer and industrial marketing strategy and tactics. Strategic marketing focuses on the concepts and processes involved in developing marketdriven strategies
Course_Hard_Skills: designing effective marketing strategies, marketing management concepts, consumer marketing strategy, industrial marketing strategy, market-driven strategies, strategic marketing concepts and processes.

Course_Name: Platform business models and the sharing economy
Course_Description: focuses on marketing strategies and emerging issues in platform business models and the sharing economy. It covers the special features, pricing, customer acquisition and management, trust building, ecosystem and governance of such business models
Course_Hard_Skills: marketing strategies, platform business models, sharing economy, special features of business models, pricing strategies, customer acquisition and management, trust building, ecosystem and governance of businesses.

Course_Description: helps you to understand the macroeconomic environments of international businesses. The course examines recent issues and trends in globalization through the lens of economic theories in international trade, political economy and macroeconomics. In particular, we will explore the origins of the recent rise of protectionism and populism in the US and Europe, the macroeconomic consequences of financial globalization and crises, and the challenges and opportunities of international migration. Combining economic analyses and case studies, we further examine the implications of these issues on the aggregate economy as well as on individual companies
Course_Hard_Skills: understanding macroeconomic environments, economic theories in international trade, political economy, and macroeconomics, recent issues and trends in globalization, analyzing the origins of the rise of protectionism and populism, analyzing macroeconomic consequences of financial globalization and crises, analyzing challenges and opportunities of international migration, combining economic analyses and case studies, examining implications of macroeconomic issues on aggregate economy and individual companies.

Course_Description: studies the multinational enterprise (MNE) and the theoretical approaches that have been formulated to explain the growth and operation of this form of business on an international scale. Recent general theories will be considered in a critical manner to allow judgments to be made on their strengths and limitations
Course_Hard_Skills: studying multinational enterprises, theoretical approaches to explain growth and operation of MNEs, critical analysis of recent general theories, making judgments on the strengths and limitations of these theories.

Course_Description: introduces theoretical frameworks for analysing culture in general and specifically for understanding Chinese business culture. Central themes throughout the course include Chinese corporate culture, culture factors embedded in business practices, and business culture reflected through films and TV shows. The course also includes an introduction to culture comparison and an in-depth discussion on exploring similarities and differences in business culture between China and other countries.
Course_Hard_Skills: analyzing culture, understanding Chinese business culture, introduction to culture comparison, exploring similarities and differences in business culture

Course_Name: A century of business in Hong Kong
Course_Description: taught in a series of lectures and tutorials, will explore the trajectory of European and Chinese business from the opening of Hong Kong as a free port in 1841 until the handover in 1997, complementing approaches of economic, social and political history.
Course_Soft_Skills: complementing approaches of economic, social and political history. (no soft skills mentioned)
Course_Hard_Skills: exploring the trajectory of European and Chinese business, complementing approaches of economic, social, and political history.

Course_Name: Applications of strategic thinking in business
Course_Description: introduce basic concepts and principles of game theory and their applications to a variety of real life business situations. The major contents include Prisoners’ Dilemma and dominant strategies, simultaneous games and Nash equilibrium, randomised strategies, sequential games and backward induction, games under imperfect information, and repeated games and cooperation
Course_Hard_Skills: introducing basic concepts and principles of game theory, applying them to real-life business situations, understanding prisoner's dilemma and dominant strategies, understanding simultaneous games and Nash equilibrium, understanding randomised strategies, understanding sequential games and backward induction, understanding games under imperfect information, and understanding repeated games and cooperation.

Course_Description: focus on the competitiveness of the economy and industries of Mainland China and examine China’s competitiveness on a regional, industry and activity basis. Globalisation and China’s accession to WTO have presented unprecedented opportunities and challenges for China’s economy and industries. As such, China’s position in the world economic system and its ability to move up the value-added ladder is critical to its sustainable economic development. Given Hong Kong’s close links to the economy of the Chinese Mainland, China’s economic future will heavily influence that of every industry in Hong Kong.
Course_Soft_Skills: examine China's competitiveness on a regional, industry, and activity basis (no soft skills mentioned).
Course_Hard_Skills: examining China's competitiveness on a regional, industry, and activity basis, assessing China's position in the world economic system, identifying opportunities and challenges presented by globalization and China's accession to WTO, and understanding the importance of China's ability to move up the value-added ladder for its sustainable economic development.

Course_Description: focus on the analytical and managerial tasks involved in developing strategies that create value by satisfying customer demands and stakeholders’ interests in an ever-changing competitive landscape. Successful business policies require a detailed understanding of the overall environment of which the firm is a part as well as the ability to create value in order to serve customers in the face of competition
Course_Hard_Skills: developing strategies that create value, satisfying customer demands and stakeholders' interests, analyzing the overall environment of which the firm is part, and creating value to serve customers in the face of competition.

Course_Description: will highlight the criticality of making profound decisions about the right pathways to firm growth. It will provide theoretical framework and guiding principles for analysing practical problems at the corporate or group level as experienced by managers.
Course_Soft_Skills: highlighting the criticality of making profound decisions about the right pathways to firm growth (no soft skills mentioned).
Course_Hard_Skills: highlighting the criticality of making profound decisions about the right pathways to firm growth, providing a theoretical framework for analyzing practical problems at the corporate or group level as experienced by managers, and guiding principles for such analysis.

Course_Description: t providing students with a profound understanding of the Latin American business environment, preparing them for a career in international business. The course will address the issues, opportunities and complexities that are associated with doing business in Latin America or with Latin American firms
Course_Soft_Skills: preparing students for a career in international business (no soft skills mentioned).
Course_Hard_Skills: providing a profound understanding of the Latin American business environment, preparing for a career in international business, addressing issues, opportunities, and complexities associated with doing business in Latin America and with Latin American firms.
